title: govols247: MVP candidates at midway mark
text:
govols247: MVP candidates at midway mark govols247.com takes at look at who is in the running for MVP for the Vols this season. Post to Facebook govols247: MVP candidates at midway mark govols247.com takes at look at who is in the running for MVP for the Vols this season.  //on.wbir.com/1LAsJnJ   Join the Conversation To   govols247: MVP candidates at midway mark Wes Rucker, govols247.com 3:25 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Oct 10, 2015; Knoxville, TN, USA; Tennessee Volunteers running back Jalen Hurd (1) directs the band after the game against the Georgia Bulldogs at Neyland Stadium. Tennessee won 38 to 31. Mandatory Credit: Randy Sartin-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Randy Sartin, Randy Sartin-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
There are more than 100 players on the Tennessee football team, and every one of them has a role. 
Not all roles are created equally, though. 
Let’s look at five candidates for team MVP at the midway mark of the 2015 season. 

Junior quarterback Joshua Dobbs : Tennessee's dual-threat junior quarterback hasn't been as consistent as he'd like so far this season, but at times he’s been spectacular. The reigning SEC Player of the Week and national player of the week according to multiple media outlets has completed 58 percent of his passes (a little down from last season) for 1,101 yards, eight touchdowns and just two interceptions, and he’s added 368 yards and five more scores on the ground. When Dobbs is on his game, he’s one of the SEC's best and most dynamic quarterbacks, and he presents all sorts of problems for opposing defenses. 

Sophomore running back Jalen Hurd : Statistics alone hardly tell the story of Hurd's sophomore season to this point, because he's had to get a lot of yards on his own. Fortunately for the Vols, though, the 6-foot-4, 242-pound Hurd is comfortably capable of doing exactly that. The surprisingly nimble and balanced big man has collected 572 yards and seven touchdowns on 126 carries through the Vols' first six games, and he's added 85 yards and one touchdown through the air. He also picks up blitzes with ease and makes defenders think twice about pinning their ears back and coming at Dobbs in the backfield. 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.wbir.com/1LAsJnJ TOP VIDEOS
